results.title: Berserk 6: God's Hand Ep. 22-25
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 22-25 (final) of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 22 Griffith is being tortured but his Hawks have not given up on him. Ep. 23 The army pursues the fleeing Hawks; Griffith is very frail; Gatsu realises the depths of his feelings for Caska. Ep. 24 As Griffith hovers between life and death, the terrible truth behind his destiny is revealed. Ep. 25 Will Gatsu and Caska become sacrificial beings, as predicted? In an attempt to save her, Gatsu faces an array of marauding beasts. Final episode of “Berserk”.

results.title: Berserk 5: Requited desires Ep. 18-21
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 18-21 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 18 Skullduggery at court threatens Griffith’s life. Ep. 19 Gatsu needs to find his own path which puts him in conflict with Griffith. Ep. 20 Away from battle, Gatsu questions the routes his life has taken. Ep. 21 With Griffith imprisoned for treason, Koska now leads the dispirited Hawks.

results.title: Berserk 4: Devil's advocate Ep. 14-17
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 14-17 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 14 Koska is trapped and Gatsu must face a brutal encounter with 100 soldiers. Ep. 15 Koksa has conflicted emotions about Gatsu and her devotion to Griffith. Ep. 16 With the aim of capturing Doldery, the knights face the strongest of Chuder’s army. Ep. 17 In the final battle between Midland and Chuder, the outcome means more than simply victory or defeat.

results.title: Berserk 3: White Hawk Ep. 10-13
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 10-13 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 10 After completing a brutal assignment, Gatsu is wounded, and haunted by his actions. Ep. 11 When Griffith heads off to war, his Hawks are involved in a bloody skirmish on the front line. Ep. 12 Stranded in a cave with Gatsu, Caska relives her brutal past. Ep. 13 Wounded and trapped in enemy territory, Caska and Gatsu struggle to rejoin their battalion.

results.title: Berserk 2: Immortal soldier Ep. 6-9
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 6-9 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of black magic and monstrous beasts, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 6: The Band of the Black Hawk has conquered the castle but Gatsu is helpless against Zodd the immortal, an indefatigable enemy. Ep. 7: Due to his band’s brave triumphs, the King honours Griffith who walks freely amid royalty, some of whom seek to undermine his growing invincibility. Ep. 8: Griffith’s ambitions threaten the harmony of his band and his friendship with Gatsu. Once more, The Band of the Black Hawk head into battle. Ep. 9: Skulduggery at court threatens Griffith’s life.

results.title: Berserk 1: War cry Ep. 1-5
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 1-5 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of black magic and monstrous beasts, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 1: Whilst the King’s merciless rule creates terror amidst the locals, Gatsu slays several of his marauding men, who fear Gatsu’s immense sword. In an attempt to devastate his power, Gatsu challenges the King in battle. Ep. 2: Basuso, a gigantic grey knight, yields terror but Gatsu confronts him. In the woods he encounters The Band of the Hawk - a mercenary army, led by the charismatic Griffith. Ep. 3: Gatsu and Griffith face each other in an almighty showdown. Ep. 4: Gatsu and Griffith develop a friendship; Gatsu experiences flashbacks from his past, including a clash with his father-figure, Gambino. Ep. 5: When The Band of the Hawk attack a castle, Gatsu tries to save Griffith from being killed by a bomb blast.

results.title: Bernstein on Beethoven: a tribute
results.creator_credit: CBS, Amberson Productions and Humphrey Burton
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein traces the life of Beethoven and plays sections from the “Piano Concerto No.1 in C Major” in a musical celebration of Beethoven’s Bicentennary at the Vienna Festival of Music. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Bernice bobs her hair
results.creator_credit: Perspective Films, Paul R. Gurian and Joan Micklin Silver
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
A young flapper bobs her hair to gain peer approval but she learns a lesson in values. An adaptation of the short story of the same title by F. Scott Fitzgerald.

results.title: Bernard Shaw's Caesar and Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions and Gabriel Pascal
results.brief_description: Vivien Leigh stars in this spectacular film adaptation of George Bernard Shaw’s play, which at the time of its making, was the most expensive and elaborate film ever made in Britain. The play describes Caesar’s years in Alexandria and the overthrow of Cleopatra’s brother, Ptolomy, who occupies the Egyptian throne. This magnificent screen adaptation of this story of greed, war, passion and love, due to its superb script, acting and photography will remain one of the true classics of British film-making.
